item.title: Pokemon GO Giving Away One Of The Best GBL Pokemon For Free
item.description:
Highlights

  • Niantic is giving away a free Altaria to Pokemon GO players to celebrate the Pokemon North America International Championships.
  • The process to redeem the free Altaria involves creating accounts and watching the championship stream.
  • Some fans are disappointed with the effort required to redeem the code, considering Altaria is not a rare Pokemon.

Niantic is giving away a free Altaria to Pokemon GO players, a Pokemon that can be extremely useful in a plethora of Great League teams. The giveaway is to celebrate the star of the Pokemon North America International Championships, where some of the best players in the world play against each other in a variety of Pokemon games alongside Pokemon GO .

Niantic has been giving a lot of treats to Pokemon GO fans lately after the lackluster Avatar update ended up disappointing a number of fans in the community. For instance, the release of the two variants of Necrozma has got the community excited as it could change the meta considerably. Amid that, there is another interesting event to look forward to.

Related
Pokemon GO Player Shares Helpful Tip to Avoid Losing Remote Raid Passes

A Pokemon GO player who lost a remote raid pass due to unfair circumstances is given some excellent advice so it doesn't happen again.

Niantic has announced a new promotional giveaway for the start of the upcoming Pokemon Championship. Players will be able to get an Altaria in Pokemon GO for free as part of the event. For players who are wondering why the Pokemon being given away is an Altaria, it is because that Altaria was used by MEweedle in the 2024 Pokemon GO Europe International Championships, and it was quite a dominating performance, to say the least.

How To Get Free Altaria Timed Research In Pokemon GO

  • Create a Pokemon Trainer Club account, if the user doesn't already have one
  • Create a Twitch account, if the user doesn't already have one.
  • Head to the Pokemon Rewards website and link the two accounts
  • Enable Twitch drops on the Twitch account
  • Watch the Pokemon North America International Championships from June 7th onward
  • Once one gets the reward, head to the Pokemon Rewards website to get the code
  • Use the code on the Pokemon web store to get the timed research

Fans are a bit disappointed with the length of the entire process, considering that it requires quite a bit of effort from their side to redeem the Pokemon GO promo code . Additionally, players should also watch the stream, which makes things even trickier. Additionally, it is crucial to note that Pokemon GO doesn't need to be linked to Pokemon Trainer Club to get the rewards.

As far as the rewards are concerned, Altaria is a pretty good Pokemon to have, featuring in one of the best Great League teams. That being said, many players were expecting much better rewards, as it is not really a Pokemon which is that hard to get. Not to forget, the Pokemon is not even the exact same one that is used by MEweedle, which is usually the case with such drops in games like Pokemon Scarlet & Violet .

item.title: Pokemon TCG Fan Shows Off Impressive Custom Game Boy
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon TCG fan creates GBA mod with real card, sparking debate among fans about card fate and creativity.
  • Fan used soldering iron to celebrate first video game with custom GBA mod, inspiring others to get creative too.

A Pokemon TCG fan has created an impressive modded Game Boy Advance based on - and actually containing - a Pokemon card. The unique creation has generated a stir among fellow fans, both for the creativity involved and the fate of the utilized Pokemon card .

While Pokemon is probably best known as the video game, the Pokemon Trading Card Game is no slouch, with tons of fans and hardcore players. The rarest cards have sold for hundreds of thousands of dollars at times, making opening Pokemon TCG packs on-stream a popular pasttime.

Related
Pokemon TCG Reveals Scarlet & Violet - Shrouded Fable Expansion

The Pokemon TCG's next set, Scarlet & Violet - Shrouded Fable, is set to release soon, featuring popular Pokemon and unique cards for dedicated fans.

Pokemon fan artemislayout shared their custom GBA with fans, which celebrates Pokemon LeafGreen with the use of a Pokemon TCG card. The GBA case is clear, and has been sealed around a Venusaur card that's been split in half, with one half of the card on either side of the case. The Venusaur card in question originates from the Pokemon TCG Scarlet and Violet 151 Expansion , which featured Gen 1 Pokemon like Bulbasaur's evolutionary line.

According to artemislayout, Pokemon LeafGreen was the first video game they ever played, making it a memorable title worth celebrating for them. According to the user, they utilized a custom mirror shell and had to use a soldering iron for the first time in order to set up the internal components inside the shell. However, they also note that fans who are interested in doing the same don't necessarily have to use a soldering iron as long as they're comfortable with always using the unit at middle-level screen brightness.

Celebrating the Pokemon TCG

Some fans in the comments were very positive about the creation, with a handful seemingly inspired to do something similar for themselves. However, others were a bit upset to see a Pokemon card treated this way. While this particular Venusaur card is nowhere near as valuable as some of the most expensive Pokemon cards in existence, it's nonetheless been destroyed to utilize in this fashion, which bothers some fans. With that said, one fan pointed out that Pokemon cards get destroyed or lost all the time by accident, so at least this one is being used in a way that will make the owner happy.

The Pokemon TCG has inspired a lot of players, leading to impressive fan art, animations, and more based on the tabletop game. Whether fans break down a card to use it in a creation like this or keep theirs tidily protected and tucked away, the game's persisting appeal and widespread fanbase is nothing to scoff at.

item.title: Fortnite Players Should Think Twice Before Picking Up Medallions
item.description:
Highlights

  • Medallions seem lucrative, but they are risky due to location markers, shown by a player in a Fortnite match.
  • Debate continues on the utility of medallions in the game, with some finding them fun while others find giving away location not worth it.
  • Fans eagerly anticipate Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 3 with a post-apocalyptic theme and partnership with Fallout.

While medallions might seem quite lucrative to acquire in a Fortnite match due to the various buffs they grant, a player has showcased why it is probably a bad idea to get one due to the location markers. Medallions have been a point of contention ever since they were released as part of Fortnite 's Chapter 5 Season 1 update, despite their functionality evolving over the seasons.

Fortnite fans are eagerly waiting for the Chapter 5 Season 3 update to release, which is slated to feature a post-apocalyptic theme. While rumors had suggested that a Mad Max collaboration could be next, Epic Games surprised fans again by announcing Fortnite's partnership with Fallout instead. As the new season approaches and revamps the Fortnite meta, fans are debating about the utility of medallions in the game.

Related
Fortnite Players Aren't Happy About the Loki Skin

Fans are disappointed with the recently added Loki, God of Stories, and Sylvie Laufeydottir skins despite a lot of hype surrounding them.

In a new post on the Fortnite subreddit, user the_haver highlights how risky getting a medallion can be. In the video, the player can get the exact location of the opponent on the map, which helps them to spot the enemy with ease. They go on to sneakily snipe down the enemy through the bush. Despite the enemy hiding behind the rock, it is the disadvantage of using a medallion that aids the player in finding them.

Fortnite Aspect of Gods Medallions Perks

  • Aspect of Siphon (Hades): Grants health after eliminating an opponent
  • Aspect of Agility (Cerberus): Grants Underworld Dash charges
  • Aspect of Speed (Zeus): Boosts movement speed and jump height
  • Aspect of Combat (Ares): Increases damage from ranged weapons

In Chapter 5 Season 2, players can get medallions, also known as the Aspect of Gods, by defeating the various NPC bosses. The likes of Zeus, Hades, Cerberus, and Ares are not easy to defeat in Fortnite , so it is not easy to get the medallions in the first place. However, each of them provides unique buffs to the player, such as improving damage, vitality, or even movement speed. Every player has their own favorite medallion depending on their playstyle, but there is a caveat to using them. Having the medallions means the player's location will be marked on the map and the more medallions one has, the more precise the location marker becomes.

Fans are once again at odds about the utility of medallions, with some players stating that it's just the opponent who didn't use them wisely, as camping with medallions doesn't make sense. A few highlighted how difficult it is to take down players with Fortnite's Aspect of Agility , contrary to the easy sniper kill that the player got. Moreover, some aggressive players emphasized how grabbing medallions ramps up the fun in the game, considering that the entire lobby starts targeting medallion holders.

On the other hand, several strategic players believe that giving away the location for merely a few buffs is just not worth it. With Fortnite's Chapter 5 Season 3 just around the corner , it remains to be seen what new medallions Epic Games has in store for the new season.

item.title: Pokemon GO Player Shares Helpful Tip to Avoid Losing Remote Raid Passes
item.description:
Highlights

  • Remote raid passes are valuable in Pokemon GO, so setting up an empty team can prevent losing them in unfair situations.
  • Free to play players need to be cautious in remote raids to avoid wasting their limited remote raid passes.
  • Niantic should implement safeguards to prevent players from losing remote raid passes in situations out of their control.

A Pokemon GO player who experienced the unfair loss of a remote raid pass has been given some excellent advice on how to avoid having the same thing happen again. With Pokemon GO remote raid passes being a limited commodity for those who don't spend money on the game, this tip could help avoid the devastating loss of a wasted remote raid pass.

Pokemon GO introduced remote raid passes during the COVID-19 pandemic , and the game mechanic has remained in the title since. Although the game has undergone some changes in the years that have passed since then, many players still enjoy participating in remote raids without having to physically go to the location. However, the game doesn't have safeguards against losing a remote raid pass when someone disconnects, and this is where the problem started for one fan.

Related
Pokemon GO Confirms Dates for Next 4 Community Day Events

Niantic confirms the dates for the next four Community Day events in Pokemon GO, which will be held throughout the course of Season 15.

Reddit user HeartDiseaseButLungs shared their unfortunate situation where they were invited to a remote mega raid, only for that person to leave just just before the fight began. As a result, HeartDiseaseButLungs lost their Pokemon GO remote raid pass , and lamented that as a free to play user, it was the only one they had. While some users felt sympathetic for them, another fan by the name of NaonAdni offered up some excellent advice. By creating an empty raid team, players can avoid losing their remote raid passes in situations like these.

As NaonAdni explained, players should set up an empty team and use it if they suspect that other players are going to leave the raid. If other players leave the raid at the last moment as HeartDiseaseButLungs experienced, instead of wasting the remote raid pass, the game will ask the player to choose a different team that actually has Pokemon in it. At this point, the user can simply quit out without expending their remote raid pass . If the raid does actually get going with everyone included, the player can instead just select their actual team with the Pokemon they want to fight with on it.

Player Safeguards and Pokemon GO Problems

Players who have gone through this unfortunate experience in Pokemon GO will likely be happy to implement this advice in the future. However, it's a shame that it's necessary in the first place. As remote raid passes can cost actual money, it would make sense for Niantic to ensure that players don't lose their passes when they never had an opportunity to actually fight. This is just one of many problems that Pokemon GO currently has that players wish would be addressed by the developer.

item.title: Fallout 4 Player Builds Dollar General in the Commonwealth
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Reddit user builds a Dollar General store in Fallout 4, including aisles to browse.
  • The Fallout 4 build received positive feedback from players wanting more similar creations.
  • Interest in Fallout 4 has increased thanks to the new Prime Video series, boosting game sales in regions like the UK and sparking creative custom mods for players.

A Fallout 4 player created an entire Dollar General store in the Commonwealth with vendors that cater to the needs of the protagonist and other nearby inhabitants. The store was built within the new PlayStation 5 version of Fallout 4 , which recently received a second next-gen update to fix lingering issues from launch.

The next-gen update for Fallout 4 was initially revealed in 2022 and scheduled for a release in 2023, but a delay would push the update to 2024. After many months of speculation, Bethesda confirmed that the next-gen update would finally arrive on April 25 with PS5 and Xbox Series X|S performance and quality modes. The update also brought free Creation Club content, new armor and weapon bundles, and bug fixes for Fallout 4 . However, the update was met with mixed reception from fans due to several bugs and technical issues, including a lack of support for ultrawide resolutions and glitches involving Fallout's signature VATS feature. As a result, Bethesda released a second next-gen update on May 13 to remedy many of the issues introduced in the prior update.

Related
Fallout 4 Player Fights Mama Murphy and Instantly Regrets It

Mama Murphy demonstrates her hand-to-hand expertise in a hilarious Fallout 4 clip where the Sole Survivor foolishly decides to pick a fight.

Reddit user Admirable_Truck4749 recently built a Dollar General store in Fallout 4 for PS5 and shared multiple screenshots of their creation for the Fallout community to see. The Commonwealth-style Dollar General store includes various vendors for goods and services, such as weapons, gear, and general goods. Like a real-life Dollar General store, various aisles may be browsed, but Admirable_Truck4749 did not place any goods to be sold just yet. A Mister Gutsy may be seen patrolling the Dollar General store as well, acting as another employee who can help customers out.

Fallout 4 Player Builds a Dollar General Store

Thousands of Fallout 4 players in the Reddit community are pleased with Admirable_Truck4749's Dollar General store, with over a hundred users sharing their thoughts in the comments. Many users jokingly want more Dollar General stores to be built in the Commonwealth, as it could bring some convenience to inhabitants like the Minutemen. Other users would like to see a Waffle House built in Fallout 4 next since the Dollar General store shares a similar aesthetic. Thankfully, mods in Fallout 4 can help make custom creations like a Waffle House possible in the game.

Interest in Fallout 4 and the Fallout series is high thanks to the new Fallout Prime Video series. In addition, the new Prime Video series helped boost sales of Fallout 4 in regions like the United Kingdom, showing that there were still players who didn't explore the Commonwealth beforehand.
